title: Am I a jerk for building carry as support?
body:
Whenever I go as support Xerath, I buy a gold coin, a ward, and spend whatever's left in health potions. My masteries and runes are the same as my mid Xerath runes and masteries (but I make sure to be extremely silent on this matter, winkwinksuppsetup)

I do my job as support slightly differently to other supports at first: I take teleport (and flash, cus it's the default.) to ensure the lane is never MIA and to let the ADC be more lenient on when to recall and when to farm. I take advantage of this by last hitting everything I can while the ADC is off buying items and slowly walking back to lane. I just poke the low mr enemy ADC until they recall or die to put them FAR behind. My mid setup makes my pokes ridiculous at early levels, and the fact the ADC is almost guaranteed to be AD and not MR (Hello Galio and Kassadin ADC, wait, you don't exist.)

Leaning phase ends with me having 3k gold unused because I poked the enemy so hard they never damaged me more than my health regen and occasional potion could take, stopping me from needing to recall when teleport was on CD.

 If my ADC is a hyper carry who doesn't look quite strong enough to survive on her own mid game (Damnit, Vayne, I don't want to be your baby sitter), I buy twin shadows, an item that benefits both of us. I repeat the teleport-farming scheme and then I continue to the next step of my diabolical plan.

If the ADC is alright, l get on with it and continue to the next step.

I buy Luden's Echo. The gold coin mixed with only 30-60 CS is enough for this bad boy. From there, I just use one Q to wave clear and get all the kill gold. If I haven't bought twin shadows, I buy it anyways to help my skill shots, chasing, and for the ADC.

From there, I build as if I was mid the whole time, pushing all the lanes to their dooms, with everyone aiming for the over leveled mid or top while I secretly buy rabadon and void and become the third carry to destroy late game. The only difference between mid and I is the fact mid gets an extra level and an extra item's worth of gold. I get an ADC hugging me while we set the enemy on fire and take over the world. I also ward, but I always ward as mid, so I don't count it as a difference.

Of course, I make sure to be more threatening than the ADC by hitting everyone in the center of my eye of destruction of doom W, so if someone falls behind, it's the Guy Who Was Meant To Support, not the actual carry.


I think my win rate as support is actually higher than my mid win rate, so I'm pretty happy with my strategy.

replies.body:
Sightstone should be proritised over everything. Always. On any support. I cant stress how much you are disadvantaging you team by not buying this. Its only 800 gold for a huge amount of information over the game(plus it saves money on normal wards anyway). Buy damage after that if you want. 

Getting the AP support item instead of coin and switching teleport for exhaust/ignite/heal will make you more effective in fights but i guess isnt completely necessary.

AP support item? What's that?

I usually use gold coin for the mana regen, and spell thief seems a bit lackluster, only 3 times every 30 seconds? Disabled on minion kill?

With sight stone... I used to buy it even with mid. But I somehow always fall far behind even after using 800 gold so I just buy stealth wards and ask the jg to ward top while I ward bot. There are very few games where I use more than 11 wards if the other players actually decide to pitch in (everyone should ward. If even the ADC isn't warding, that's a lot of potential lost for just 225 gold.)

Teleport = more gold and the removal of MIA, there's very little trade for that when considering ignite and exhaust's max range is Xerath's danger zone. And potions.
the coin is actually the least stat/gold efficient support item
Dat activatable tho... It's like a free Sivir

pretty sure the 80% +damage slow beats the 40% ms, and the stats and gold generation are better on the frost queen, the only advantage is on people who need mana sustain aswell as hp sustain to survive, like soraka, needing the healing and mana to keep her heals going

140 damage actually isn't a lot at level 18 and slows don't stack anymore, while Talisman has the second highest MS boost for an item, and is one of the only to give it in an AoE. (Also, harassing later on without taking minions is a pain for me and I always end up selling it towards late game)

Talisman does fall behind on gold per second compared to Frost Queen, but Relic shield is muuuuuuuch worse.
yet 90% of the time {{item:3401}} earns gold closer to {{item:3092}}  than it does the {{item:3069}}  anyway

Technically, yes, it does.

But for all intents and purposes, I could replace face of the mountain with Amplifying tome and still get the same result.

Yea spellthief is the one i mean. Its basically the same gold as first teir coin and significantly more when you upgrade to frostfang as long as you use the procs (and its not hard to hit someone 3 times in 30 seconds with a ranged champ). The additional 10 damage per hit is also fairly big for early poke and fighting. And disabling on minion kills shouldnt be an issue during laning phase anyway.

With regard to the sightstone, placing less than 11 wards during the game is SUPER low, even if the rest of your team is warding. You can have 3 out at a time, and they last 3 mins each, so it doesnt take long to surpass that if you're warding properly.

Wow, I never bothered doing the math, but my endgame stats always seem lower than I expect. I'll make sure to be more careful and watch when I forget to ward.

When should I upgrade to a ruby sight stone, though? It's a lot of wards that can't even be used at once...
Yea upgrading to ruby sightstone is usually a waste. Just stick with the normal one until you run out of other stuff to spend money on
As long as your winning keep up with your strategy :D Goodluck

This won't work regularly..

Play more games and wait until a decent jg smecks you.

Do u provide enough peel for adc? D: 
Also, I agree with McRuthless... Sightstone is a beast item c:

Peel as in: getting the enemy team off the ADC's back? In chases of 1-3 I use twin shadows then stun for the guy in front, If there's more than 3, I use W and usually hit 4 guys at the center, then save my stun for anyone who dodges or gets close to the ADC.

Another difference between my playstyle at mid than supp: I max W first for the slow, and I play semi suicidal so the enemy prioritizes me over the ADC.
this sort of play is fine for normal matches, but if you played in ranked i'd report for griefing - assisting enemy team.
